meanings.definition: To bring into existence or make something new
meanings.sent1: I will reate a drawing for the art class.
meanings.sent2: She loves to reate beautiful melodies on her guitar.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to reate a rabbit out of thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to reate a joyful atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The chef's skillful hands reate culinary masterpieces.

meanings.definition: To cause something to happen or occur
meanings.sent1: The loud noise will reate a disturbance in the library.
meanings.sent2: His careless actions reate chaos wherever he goes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to reate a mess in the living room.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news reated a ripple effect throughout the community.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds reated havoc in the coastal town.

meanings.definition: To produce or give rise to something
meanings.sent1: The factory can reate thousands of products in a day.
meanings.sent2: The sun's warmth can reate a sense of comfort on a chilly day.
meanings.sent3: His words seemed to reate a sense of unease among the audience.
